title: America’s Hidden Damage, World’s Most Solved Unsolved Mystery 2.2.21
itunes:title: America’s Hidden Damage, World’s Most Solved Unsolved Mystery 2.2.21
description:
In episode 803, Jack and Miles are joined by New York public defender Eliza Orlins, who is running for Manhattan district attorney, to discuss the mental health crisis, America's broadband problem, the Dyatlov Pass incident, and more!

FOOTNOTES:

  1. Eliza Orlins for Manhattan District Attorney
  2. Anti-Vaxxers Won’t Stop Harassing Nurse They’re Convinced Is Dead
  3. Shape-Shifting Virus Threatens Cycles of Illness, Lockdowns
  4. Chilling trend: A longer, deadlier pandemic
  5. The Problem With Mental Health Awareness
  6. Social media damages teenagers' mental health, report says
  7. Why rural Americans are having a hard time working from home
  8. Race and the digital divide: Why broadband access is more than an urban vs rural issue
  9. America’s Terrible Internet Is Making Quarantine Worse
  10. President Obama Details Plan to Win the Future through Expanded Wireless Access
  11. How Biden’s FCC could fix America’s internet
  12. Wired to fail
  13. Trump Made A Mess Of Tech Policy. Here's What Biden Is Inheriting
  14. Affordable broadband is finally within reach
  15. US relief package provides $7 billion for broadband
  16. Has science solved one of history’s greatest adventure mysteries?
  17. WATCH: Ta-ku - Remember Me

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com
